comment: I took this as a 4 Week class and Prof. Zhen made it easy to succeed. Grading criteria is clear, and all the coursework was open from the start. It is not the most intensive class, but still requires attention and reading. She also provides limited EC. If you need an elective, I recommend this class as it is not that difficult and very interesting.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Such an easy class and professor. The only assignments were quizzes each week (no webcam or lockdown), and a few discussion posts. One paper at the end. Super easy A. Definitely take her if you can!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Zhan has made this class extremely accessible. The coursework is not extensive nor demanding. Only quizzes, no tests. There is one paper, but it is not difficult and Dr. Zhan is always there to help guide you. Definitely take this class with Dr. Zhan!!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment:
Great professor. I learned a lot. Work was not overloaded. Took during the summer with a heavy load. 
This was one of my best classes hands down! I would definitely take her again.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Taker her for this course. There is reading and a quiz weekly but overall the course is an easy A plus.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: I love Dr. Zhan. She is straightforward with her course materials and expectations. She is caring and understanding with her students. She also offers extra credit as an option. Would absolutely take again.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Caring--Respected

comment: I took this over the summer. It was an extremely easy class with clear grading criteria. As long as you turn everything in youll get a good grade.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Information from quizzes always came different from the materials provided. 10 quizzes total (highest 8 counted). 4 DB (not including the intro DB) and an easy TV project with a mini essay. Shes a good choice for this course and so is using quizlet
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very straightforward class. Do the quizzes and assignments and you'll be fine. There's also a free textbook, which helped studying for quizzes

Professor Zhan was fair and clear about what was expected. I LOVE that she didn't assign any busy work - all assignments (a couple of discussions, one case study, a few quizzes, a mid-term exam, and a non-comprehensive final) were clearly designed to enhance my long-term understanding of the subject matter. All quizzes/exams were open-book.
rating_tags: Respected--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Took for human development and it was an easy class. A free online textbook is provided. 10 quizzes straight from the powerpoint and textbook. Questions were pretty easy as long as you studied. 4 discussion posts and 1 cumulative final. Take her!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took this class during the four week semester and it went well. It was graded based on quizzes (which are open-note), 3 discussions (one of which was just an intro), and a tv show assignment (which isn't difficult). Make sure you read the assigned chapters and notes and you should do okay.

I took a 4-week summer online class for Hum Dev. The professor responds within 24-hrs to email. Its lots of reading, chapter quizzes, and a weekly discussion or other writing assessment. The quizzes are sometimes oddly specific to very minute details. For an online class I learned a lot. Professor grades fairly. Do the work, its an easy A.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Prof. Zhan is a fair grader, I took her Cross-Cultural Psychology class during the summer for 4-weeks and learned a lot. You will read two chapters per week, 3 quizzes from reading the chapters with a 20 minutes limit, a case study, and 2 discussion posts. Please read small details in each chapter to prepare yourself with the quizzes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: This class was actually interesting and the easiest A. The material is not difficult, lots from Psych 1101. The textbook was provided in PDF format. Quizzes in every chapter are v easy. The discussion assignments are also incredibly easy and are actually fun. Fair grader, and responds quickly to emails. Her rating should be higher.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Really wonderful class, I actually felt like I was learning things! She also is a very fair grader, I'd absolutely take any PSYC class she is teaching.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The class itself was fine. I was in Child Development at the same time so I was basically tested twice over the same stuff. Everything is on Connect (quizzes and study modules), but there are bi-weekly discussions over topics from Taking Sides or videos. No exams, just a final at the end. Very easy if you are diligent and can keep up with the work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: You dont really learn anything, I mean its an easy A but the lectures are pointless and the material is just reading outdated material. If you just need someone to take for credit I would go for her I guess.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I was thrilled to take Cross-Cultural, but Dr. Zhan doesn't like teaching it. Hybrid course -- everything online was average but lectures were absolutely useless. The whole class is her saying "you all already know this right?" and then not knowing how to teach when students are confused. Attendance is graded so can't skip. Didn't learn a thing.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I enjoyed this class. Each week there is reading, a quiz, and either a discussion post or responses (online). Super easy to do and she is an easy grader. Reading is very important for an A in this class. All in all, it's straight to the point and very simple.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: It's an online class so you should be expecting to read. Her quizzes are very specific and you must know a the small details. You can use the book for them. I learned a lot but it's very easy to pass with minimal effort.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Only problem I had with her was she does not post grades until the day they are due at the END of the semester. Homework, quizzes and test were very easy just read the book that is provided online through the connect site. Lots of discussions and having to reply to students. Watched 5 documentaries each an hr long. Easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Zhan is a great teacher especially online! You have book modules, quizzes, and discussions due every week which is not that fun and take up time but compared to a real physical class isn't much. The quizzes are a bit tricky. She is a nice lady and response quickly to email. She isn't that picky about grading.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: She expects perfect attendance, even though all the learning comes from reading. Random group assignments that you get a 0 for if you miss, and there's no make-up. She also gives attendance grades, but doesn't keep up with attendance well. She took off points for missing days that I didn't miss, and wouldn't change it. I don't recommend it at all.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I had this teacher for Asian studies and Lifespan and I'm just going to say she runs both of her classes about the same with a huge cumulative test at the end. Honestly, I wouldn't take her for another class because she is stressful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: Alright, so professor Khan is a very nice lady. She cares and gives feedback on various assignments so you know what you did wrong. HOWEVER, the amount of work you have to do each week is very heavy. There are weekly book assignments that take me literally hours to complete. The material isn't too hard there is just a lot of it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: This is not a class you can ever miss a day. She assigns a random pop quizzes and you lose two points every day that you don't show up to class. You have to watch videos and then participate in discussions. Midterm project and questions have to be written up. She grades harshly. Do not take this class with this teacher. Worst class I have had at K
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Reading, quizzes, and discussion posts required every week, plus two very short papers. Amount of work was about average for online course. But comprehensive final over 19 chapters is little much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Do not take her for Asia class.  No matter what you write on your discussion, she will never give you full points.  She wants to make sure no one gets an A and enjoys watching you struggle for a B in such a pointless class.  Class is canceled often so you can go home and watch aan Asian movie and then write discussions that are harshly graded.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters

comment: The discusssions are too complex and are graded harshly.  You basically read and write long discussions every week and when you think you did a good job, you are shocked at your C on a well researched discussion.  Don't take her.

The tests are  nit-picky and cover concepts not in the online lecture material. I'm not sure where you are supposed to find the information.  People get frustrated because they think they are prepared, but the test questions stump you.  You can't look up anything online because they are worded so that you must know every detail within 10 seconds

If you like to write 24 hours a day, then take this class.  I put so much effort into my discussion questions only to have them ripped apart.  I would avoid at all costs.  You will be pulling your hair out
rating_tags: Tough Grader

comment: She is harsh on grading discussion assignments.  She is too picky on the content.  I worked hard for a C.  Stay away.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: The class is boring and you have to watch long movies and participate in discussion questions.  SHe take attendance too, which should not be required.  She grades too difficult on discussion and quizzes.  I would NOT recommend her.
Would recommend this class to everyone I come in contact with.  Easy, easy, easy A.

The most straightforward online professor I've had.  Class consists of weekly discussion questions, quizzes, and study modules.  Only a couple of easy papers and documentaries to watch.  The final was a little difficult b/c it asked for the most uncalled questions.  But if you just do you work you'll get an easy A so that the final is not a worry.

She is the most organized online professor I had. Her online course was easy to follow and navigate. Clear instructions and grading rubric. Gives ample time to do each chapter assignments, discussion posts, & responses. You can easily make an A or B in her class. She's not one to overwhelm her students with unnecessary homework.

I took this class spring semester 2016 & Professor Zhan is a breeze, this class doesn't take up much of your time and the syllabus is laid out very clearly for what you are responsible for and what is expected each week. Minimal effort required, answers to weekly quizzes on quiz let, two small "papers", weekly discussion post, easy A...

She grades very EASILY. She assigns two books, but only only one of them is really used (cross-culture psychology). The quizzes are MC & easy--most questions are just definitions.  To the person below--seriously? It is a hybrid class. What do you expect? She covers the most important information in class & you learn the little things yourself.

I am currently taking Zhan for Cross Cultural psychology. She assigns two books for you to read from, as if one is not enough and then teaches nothing in class. Not only will the reading deprive you of time for your other classes, she expects you to post discussions online and watch videos that are an hour + long. Do not take her.

I really enjoyed taking Intro to Asian Cultures with Professor Zhan. She really gave me an overall understanding of all aspects of Asian Cultures and we even had guest lectures on religion, tea, and Thailand. It's an easy class with no tests, weekly homework, one easy group project, and a final that's online and open book too.

Overall, she was decent. I took ASIA 1101 as a gen ed. The only thing I don't like is you had to come up with questions about the readings, like "What is the effect of this event on the economy"... something like that. It was pointless to me. BUT no quizzes, tests, or midterm. final was online and you had 3 hours to do it (open book too).

I saw reviews and was wary about whether I should take her or not, however, I am glad I did!! Everyone posts about how the quizzes are hard, however, they are all on quizlet! Basically if you do the assignments and discussion posts/responses, you get a 100. WOULD DEFINITELY TAKE HER AGAIN!!!

Prof. Zhan is not helpful at all. She always says "it is in the syllabus" or refer to syllabus. She does not answer questions. She takes days to email back and if she decides to email back. Her response "it is in the syllabus" She does not care for her students and is a very tough psychology teacher. STAY AWAY FROM HER CLASS. DO NOT TAKE PERIOD!

Honestly Dr. Ginny is somewhat not a good communicator, constantly late to class, to understand her; who'll have to be a pro on female "She talk" Very hard to follow, and she gives poor feedback. If you miss the exam for any reason other than you were involved on a deadly accident on your way to class, you'll never get to retake that exam.

Outstanding professor! Weekly discussion post kept me engaged. Provides detailed feedback on assignments. Two major assignments that are pretty fun. Workload is manageable as long as you stay on task. I would take her class again!

I really enjoyed this professor.  She was really enthusiastic about the course.  I took this class as a hybrid class so I only had to go to class on a Friday.  Make sure you go to the mandatory classes because it is part of your grade.  She is really funny and fun to listen to.  I definitely recommend taking one of her courses if you can.

Took this class online and it was horrible. The subject is interesting but wow does this woman like to give out assignments. Quiz, study module and discussions every single week and a couple papers. Wouldn't be so bad if discussions were about our chapters but she wants you reading another book on top of that. Who has time for this?!?!!!

Professor Zhan is awesome! I took her online and received an A. Easy A if you read the chapters and stay up to date with the quizzes and study modules. A weekly study module and quiz, 1 small assignment and 1 reflection paper at the end of the semester. Overall a pretty easy course, would definitely recommend Professor Zhan!

I took Dr. Zhan for a hybrid Cross cultural psyc class and her tests kicked my butt to the point that I thought I was gonna fail. (Extra credit and attendance points saved me!!) Her weekly discussion boards were interesting and varied and her lectures were also good. Don't take her classes lightly though. Put in effort.

I took this class online and enjoyed it a lot more than I thought I would. Dr. Zhan is very helpful if you ever have a question just shoot her an email and she will get back to you ASAP. She lays out coursework very clearly and assignment due dates are told to you regularly. It's easy if you read the text and do everything you need to.

She's an ok professor but... she's a harsh test grader. Assignments are all very easy but the test comes out of no where. Tests are online and you wold think that makes them easy but the questions that are asked are so out of left field. If you don't put the answer exactly as the wants it then it's wrong.  same exact meaning but it's still wrong.

I took this online.To pass any of the quizzes you pretty much have to take notes on every sentence of the book or else you won't pass the quizzes. Isn't helpful on reminding you when things are due.The learning modules are ridiculous.Get prepared for hundreds of questions. Do not take.
She seems to assign arbitrary grades and loves to asks random questions on quizzes that hold little value. It's a tough A, but passable.

Very nice professor. Usually responds to inquiries within a day or two. Make sure to scan syllabus and rubrics/do not ask a question if it's already posted. Easy discussions - reference text and hit word count. Marathon tests - 100 questions/2hrs - wheweee. Read the chapters and memorize the heck out of them. Consistent with upper-level coursework.

I highly recommend taking this course online. Professor Zhan is very organized and goes directly by her syllabus. There are bi-weekly discussions which are super easy and 5 exams, but she drops your lowest grade. The exams are timed (100 Q's in 120 minutes) but if you study her powerpoints and skim the chapters you will get an A.

Dev psych. Very hard 100 question tests.  Some of the information comes from outer space.  Can't revisit any questions, have to answer one at a time in the order given. Only gives you 120 min.  1.2 min per question. Ridiculous. Who gives 100 questions on any test except "maybe" a final? Can drop one test.  Find someone else. Have to buy 2 books.

Dr Z is the best! Aim to take her if you can. She is very orgainzed and makes her expectations clear from the start. If you do not get an A in her class it will be your fault. There are 4 quizzes, weekly discussion posts, 2 very short projects, & 3 super easy group projects. The book is a MUST for quizzes...take the hybrid class.

Dr. Zhan is a very sweet person, and certainly seems willing to help, but the lectures were boring and completely pointless.  If you want an A, be prepared to read and study the text and the powerpoints and READ THE ASSIGNED ARTICLES.

I took this class online and it was a BREEZE. I got a very high B, but that's only because I missed a bunch of discussions(completely my fault that I didn't get an A). The tests are easy because you take them online and can use your book/whatever else you want.

This class was very easy! I made an A no problem! You will need the textbook but only for test purposes. Powerpoints are posted online. She follows the syllabus so no surprises. Very nice and helpful. I am taking her again online this summer.

Life-span development online class.  Easy class as far as work assignments and grading, hardest part are the 2 hour long exams.  There are 5 and she throws out the lowest grade.  Very helpful and caring lady.
I took Professor Zhan's online class during the summer. She's very helpful, but the online class was somewhat boring (as they usually are). Overall a good class though.

I took her for an online class, and she was not bad. She's very fair and clear about what she wants. It was SO boring, but that's probably because it was online. Though she was great, I can't say the same for online classes. They are not worth the convenience.

Dr. Zhan is very nice and helpful. She is straight to the point & follows here syllabus to a T. I took her online summer 2009 and I rarely had to email her for anything. I would STRONGLY suggest taking any class she teaches. She is one of the more better professors in the dept. There's not to many...TRUST ME!!!
She was an awesome professor. She is there to help you, and also she follows the syllabus to a T. Could not have a better, more knowledgeable person teaching this course material.
This was a really easy class!  If you just attend and pay attention, you can pass without much effort. With a little more effort, it is very easy to get an A.

HEr classes are pretty easy, most of the time she lectures.  The tests are pretty detailed, but if you do terrible on one there is an optional term paper that can replace the lowest grade.  Two extra assignments are really easy, just study for the tests.
Very nice lady but overall a pretty boring class.  She wasn't difficult but not that interesting either.

Dr. Zhan is extremely knowledgeable, warm and caring. There are no surprises, she pretty much sticks to the syllabus throughout the semester and expects work to be handed in on time. She posts thorough reviews on WebCT before each exam and tests are detailed but fair. Attendance is mandatory. Not an easy A, but very doable with a bit of work.

With this class comes a lot of reading, luckily the material was pretty easy to grasp and her class lectures had a lot of student involvement & were actually fun! I took her 2.5hour Friday class & got an A. Definitely keep up w/reading the chapters, take notes, pay attention & you'll do great!

Dr. Zahn is GREAT!  She explains things well.  She makes class interesting.  Her test are fairly tough but they reflect your knowledge of the subject. I have taken her for 2 classes and plan to take her for Cross Sukltural Psych too.
Sometimes funny, pretty easy
pretty boring class, but i got an A, so i cant complain

One of my all-time favorite teachers. She is a HUGE asset to KSU (she's the caliber that could be teaching at an Ivy League school). Her lectures are very interesting, she is a warm person who cares about her students' success, and she challenges you-- in a good way!
she is the best.
Excellent. Dr. Zahn is fair and does a very good job of making sure you learn the material. If you read and take decent notes, you will do fine.
awesome teacher! had alot of fun in her class, she was always there when you needed her! definately recomment her to anyone who enjoys pysch
